introText: The Ministry of Mines oversees Ontario's mining sector, promoting responsible resource development while ensuring safety and environmental protection in mining operations.
descriptionText: The Ontario Ministry of Mines spent $549M in fiscal year (FY) 2023-24, representing 0.3% of the $206.6B in total provincial spending. This investment supports mining development and oversight.
roleText: Mining is an important part of Ontario's economy, particularly in northern regions. This ministry regulates mining operations, promotes exploration and development, and ensures mining activities meet safety and environmental standards.
programsDescription: The Ministry of Mines operates programs including mining regulation, exploration incentives, Indigenous partnerships, critical minerals development, and mining safety oversight.
